Ubuntu Friendly is an open hardware validation programme for desktops, netbooks and laptops which allows you to validate your computer as "Ubuntu Friendly" based test results. The Ubuntu Friendly website lists systems that are were tested and work to different degrees with a particular release of Ubuntu.

Ubuntu Friendly is a community driven hardware validation programme, not a certification programme (for the Certification see <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com/certification|Ubuntu Certified programme]]</nowiki>). Its goal is to have a list of rated systems that people have tested with a particular release of Ubuntu.
